lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to Linear Equations in Two Variables

games.name: Equation Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present a mix of equations (linear in one variable, linear in two variables, non-linear). Ask the player to identify which ones are linear equations in two variables using button selection. Check for the presence of two variables and degree one.
learningPoints: Definition of a Linear Equation in Two Variables
Distinguishing from other types of equations

games.name: Real-World Scenario Builder
games.implementationDetails: Present a real-world scenario (e.g., cost of pens and pencils). Use input fields to define variables and write a linear equation representing the scenario. Provide tips and explanation for defining variable for situation based statement
learningPoints: Translating real-world problems into linear equations
Understanding the meaning of linear equations

games.name: Term Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Show different linear equation terms with two variables and ask students to identify which one is ax + by term

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Standard Form: ax + by + c = 0

games.name: Standard Form Converter
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation in a non-standard form. Use drag-and-drop or button selection to rearrange the terms into the standard form (ax + by + c = 0). Check term manipulations and provide hint based arrangement

games.name: Spot the standard form!
games.implementationDetails: Present linear equation and ask students whether it is in standard form or not
learningPoints: Difference between standard form and other form
Rearranging of expression for conversion to standard form

games.name: Term mover
games.implementationDetails: Ask students to move equations on side to get it into standard form

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Identifying the Coefficients a, b, and c

games.name: Coefficient Extractor
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation in standard form. Use input fields for the player to enter the values of a, b, and c. Check against the equation's coefficients. Give feedback and points based on the right number of identification.

games.name: Coefficient builder
games.implementationDetails: Ask students to build an expression given values of coefficients a, b, and c

games.name: Coefficient selector
games.implementationDetails: Provide a multiple choice question with multiple options of coefficients for different terms

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Expressing One-Variable Equations in a Two-Variable Form

games.name: Variable adder
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation in one variable. Use drag-and-drop or input fields to add the missing term (0y or 0x) to express it in two-variable form. Check the resulting equation is equivalent and linear.

games.name: Variable addition identifier
games.implementationDetails: Show how expressions gets converted from one variable to two variable and ask students to identity that number which was multiplied with new variable and converted

lessons.title: Lesson 5: What is a Solution to a Linear Equation in Two Variables?

games.name: Solution Checker
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation in two variables and an ordered pair (x, y). Check value equality after substitution in the expression by drag and drop

games.name: Point addition
games.implementationDetails: Add different numbers to equation and select from given options if both are same after adding to them or not

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Verifying if a Given Ordered Pair is a Solution

games.name: Solution Verifier
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation and a set of ordered pairs. Use radio button based selection to show if it solution or not

games.name: Which one is in?
games.implementationDetails: Show points and equation ask student which point satisfy that equation

lessons.title: Lesson 7: Understanding that Linear Equations in Two Variables have Infinitely Many Solutions

games.name: Solution Generator
games.implementationDetails: Use input fields for the x value and generate value for y. Explain that this pair of value is solution. Generate several solutions and show that they are infinite.

games.name: Solution calculator
games.implementationDetails: Display linear equation and set one variable value with a range and set formula for calculating other with this range

lessons.title: Lesson 8: Methods for Finding Multiple Solutions to a Linear Equation

games.name: Solution Method Explorer
games.implementationDetails: Implement multiple methods for finding solutions (e.g., substituting x, substituting y, rearranging the equation). Present these using a step based system so that users can visualise and apply

games.name: Formula builder
games.implementationDetails: For equation get value in terms of other variable

lessons.title: Lesson 9: Finding an Unknown Constant (k) when a Solution is Given

games.name: Constant Solver
games.implementationDetails: Present a linear equation with an unknown constant (k) and a given solution (x, y). Use input fields and guide to solve the equation for k. Check the answer and provide feedback.

games.name: Constant identifier
games.implementationDetails: Display a series of steps to find value of unknown constant and ask for the identifier step from other steps
